title: BBC Local Live: Herefordshire & Worcestershire on Friday 18 August 2017 - BBC News
summary: inquest into eight-year-old 's death to be held at end of year .

documents.title: mystery man found in river identified
text: mystery man found in river identified

documents.title: five teams into t20 blast quarter-finals
text: five teams into t20 blast quarter-finals

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of regular updates , news , sport , travel and weather , from 08:00 on monday .
keep an eye out here for any breaking news during the evening .

documents.title: inquest into eight-year-old 's death to be held at end of year
text: the inquest into the death of an eight-year-old boy from redditch is expected to be held in december .
callum cartlidge died after paramedics were allegedly denied permission to take him to the alexandra hospital two minutes from his home .
he suffered a cardiac arrest at home and was pronounced dead after arriving at the worcestershire royal hospital .

documents.title: your nature up close
text: one of our bbc weather watcher regulars , paul wilde , is the master of the close-up photo .
here are two examples taken at the knapp nature reserve near alfrick .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: weather : showers tomorrow and more on sunday
text: we 'll have a few showers tomorrow and more on sunday , but the weather is expected to improve next week .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: pc disqualified for drink driving
text: pc disqualified for drink driving

documents.title: tips for a special parkrun weekend
text: it 's a special weekend in parks around the country .
tomorrow , those who take part in their local parkrun might find themselves jogging alongside some of the country 's sporting stars .
it 's all part of campaign for national lottery funded athletes to give back and say thank you .
and , if you 've never heard of of done a parkrun , it 's really easy to get involved .
here 's team gb rowing legend katherine grainger to give you the low down in five simple steps

documents.title: self-defence running class after women report attacks
text: a self-defence class has been organised by a running club in worcester after female joggers were targeted in a series of sexual assaults in the city .
in july , west mercia police said they were investigating a string of attacks .
the black pear joggers ran a workshop last night covering the law , avoiding danger and self-defence .
organisers say they may put on more classes in the future .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: kidderminster harriers move : current site not 'at the heart of our community '
text: the chairman of kidderminster harriers says the club is proposing leaving aggborough and building a new stadium so it can be in the `` right position '' for the local community .
the club , which has been at its current site since 1890 , wants to move to a site at zortech avenue , close to stourport , and sell their current home for housing redevelopment .
harriers hope that this will `` secure the long-term future of the club '' .
the simple fact of the matter is that we can not be at the heart of our community if we 're sat in the middle of a housing estate .
the local population is growing dramatically and we just are n't physically in the right position to offer what we believe a football club should offer its community . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your questions on london midland losing its rail franchise answered
text: rail services in the west midlands are to be run by a new operator from december - but what does this mean for passengers ?
west midlands trains ltd says it will put £ 1bn into improving the routes it takes over from london midland .
the plans include 400 new carriages , free wifi and space for an extra 85,000 passengers on rush-hour services in birmingham and london .
news website readers sent in questions about the takeover and you can read some of the answers here .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: cricket : worcestershire prepare for final t20 blast game
text: tonight will see the final t20 blast match of the season for worcestershire rapids when they head to derbyshire falcons .
it 's been a disappointing campaign for the rapids who are destined to finish second-bottom of the north group .
hereford and worcester will have full commentary on the game with play due to start from 19:00 .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: wheelchair rugby player takes on obstacle course to support his club
text: a wheelchair user from herefordshire will take on a 12-mile ( 19km ) obstacle course tomorrow to try and raise the profile of his rugby club .
andy holley plays for the hereford harriers wheelchair rugby team and will be taking on the course supported by other members of his team .
i love a challenge and we 're just putting it out there to get people more aware , able-bodied and disabled-bodied people alike , to come and have a test of the club and see if they enjoy it . ''

documents.title: olympian continuing arctic challenge
text: an olympic rower from worcestershire is continuing his attempt to be one of the first men to row across the arctic ocean .
gold medalist alex gregory is part of a six-man team taking on the 2,000-mile challenge that has never been successfully completed before .
the rower has posted an update on a his progress as he bids to raise enough money to build a school in the himilayas .

documents.title: twin brothers from ledbury get identical a-level grades
text: twin brothers from ledbury are both off to the same university after getting exactly the same a-level grades yesterday .
it should n't be a huge surprise because oscar and charlie parkman got exactly the same gcse grades two years ago .
the 18-year-olds , who both went to monmouth school for boys , got their a-levels in different subjects though and say they plan to take different courses when they get to bristol university .
if i am being honest , i thought that university could have been a good time for my brother and me to go in different directions .
but we are both going to bristol .
we might be in the same halls of residence but we are taking different subjects . ''

documents.title: libraries first in the county to become members of alliance
text: libraries across bromsgrove are the first in the county to become members of the dementia action alliance
author: Bromsgrove Standard

documents.title: body found six days ago in river avon still not identified
text: almost a week after a man 's body was pulled from the river avon in worcestershire , police are still trying to identify him .
the man , described as white and probably aged between 60 and 70 years old , was recovered near k52 lock in pershore on saturday morning .
despite efforts by west mercia police , officers said they had so far been unable to trace any relatives .
his death is not being treated as sus police said .
it 's unusual for us to have been unable to identify someone but sadly , despite numerous inquiries , we have n't been able to thus far for this man . ''
author: BBC News England

documents.title: recruitment day for out-of-work factory workers
text: a hereford care company is hoping to persuade former gelpack workers to make a change of career .
the packing firm has made 175 people redundant last week after administrators failed to find a buyer .
kemble at home is holding a recruitment day at its offices at rotherwas today and have a number of vacancies from care managers to live-in carers .

documents.title: worcester mum wants children and parents to learn cpr
text: a mum-of-three from worcester is hoping sharing the story of her young son 's near death in a swimming pool will help prevent the same thing happening to other families .

becky denning poole 's five-year-old son genson got into difficulties in the water while on a family holiday in spain - and was only saved thanks to the quick thinking of his grandfather , who performed mouth-to-mouth and cpr .
now she is campaigning for free first aid courses for both primary school children and their parents .
it would save lives if children knew what to do , but also parents , so that if the unthinkable happens , that somebody would know what to do . ''

documents.title: butterfly numbers soar as nature reserve prepares for anniversary
text: twenty years of conservation work 's going to be celebrated at a worcestershire nature reserve later this month .
the county 's wildlife trust says it bought grafton wood in 1997 and that it 's home to over 40 species of bird and a nationally rare bat .
staff say in that time they 've witnessed the number of brown hairstreak butterflies at the site grow for zero to hundreds .
the anniversary will be marked on 27 august as part of their annual brown hairstreak walk .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mystery over man 's body found in river
text: mystery over man 's body found in river

documents.title: community rallies to support family of two-year-old amputee
text: a toddler who had to have his fingers , thumbs and feet amputated has amazed his parents with his resilience and determination as he learns to adapt to his new way of life .
author: Redditch Advertiser

documents.title: kidderminster harriers move : aggborough 's best days
text: as kidderminster harriers say they want to build a new out-of-town stadium , we 've been looking back at their best days at aggborough :
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: £ 11m pavement revamp plan
text: pavements across worcestershire are to get an £ 11m revamp .
the county council has approved an extra £ 6m investment on top of the existing £ 5m budget , which will be used to improve paths across the county over the next two years .

documents.title: missing girl found , police confirm
text: a missing teenager from beoley in redditch , who has links to coventry , has been found , police say .
cindy worthington had been reported missing on monday evening .
missing girl from redditch found thanks for all your help .
kevin
that 's great news
it is .
was real worry .
safe & well ?

documents.title: local royal british legion branches answer the call
text: ledbury and newent members of the royal british legion will take part in the biggest event in the organisation 's history , with a special once in a lifetime visit to world war one battlefields and the menin gate .
author: Ledbury Reporter

documents.title: kidderminster harriers plan to leave aggborough
text: kidderminster harriers say they want to leave aggborough and build a new out-of-town stadium near wyre forest golf club .
the former football league club plan to move to a site at zortech avenue , close to nearby stourport , and sell their current home for housing redevelopment .
harriers hope that this will `` secure the long-term future of the club '' .
they have now submitted proposals to wyre forest district council .

we 're restricted in terms of our progress and our growth in our current location and we believe moving to another location we 're in a position to offer not only a really good football offering on the pitch wit ha succesfull football team , but a lot more to the local community as well . ''

documents.title: watch : today 's weather in 54-seconds
text: friday 's started with sunshine for much of the west midlands and here 's how the rest of the day and the start of this weekend is looking .
get the latest forecasts for your area at any other time via the bbc weather website .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to herefordshire and worcestershire live on friday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .

documents.title: harriers plan to leave aggborough
text: harriers plan to leave aggborough

documents.title: footballer reports racism from stands
text: footballer reports racism from stands

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates in the evening and into the morning .

documents.title: munitions factory worker dies
text: ethel williams , one of the so-called canary girls who worked at the rotherwas munitions factory in hereford , has died less than a fortnight after she was honoured for her work .
she up her commemorative badge at the herefordshire country fair earlier this month .
she became ill just a few days later .
she also worked at blackpole in worcester and factories in kidderminster .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: police try to identity man 'after fan racially abused player '
text: police investigating an allegation that a fan racially abused a redditch united player during their away game at kettering town say they are still trying to identify a man .
more than 600 people were at the match on tuesday .
kettering town say they have a zero-tolerance approach to such behaviour and apologise to both the player involved and redditch united .
the player made his feelings known to the match referee .
the referee has then made the officials of kettering town football club aware and i believe then that they have identified the male .
he 's kind of left very quickly which is why we have n't got an actual identity of the person . ''
author: Anna Russell
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: weather : some showers on the way tomorrow
text: we 're forecast a dry and mild night , but there could be a few showers tomorrow .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: call for action over anti-social behaviour in rubery and rednal
text: a spate of anti-social behaviour on edgewood road has led a group of concerned rubery and rednal residents to call for police action .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: city play areas revamped
text: a number of play areas have been revamped by worcester city council .
more than £ 160,000 has been spent on refurbishing existing play areas and creating a new one near oldbury road , opposite newbury road , which is now open .
the authority has refurbished or provided new equipment at areas in kgv playing fields , trotshill lane east , medway road , caisters avenue and oaklands .

documents.title: police `` extremely concerned '' over missing teenager
text: a teenager missing from beoley in redditch , who officers are `` extremely concerned '' about , has links to coventry , warwickshire police say .
cindy worthington was reported missing on monday evening .
we 're extremely concerned for cindy 's welfare and would urge anyone who has seen her or knows of her whereabouts to contact us as a matter of urgency . ''

documents.title: mep speaks of condition after first wife 's death
text: a ukip mep has been telling bbc hereford & worcester of his heartache at the rare condition that led to the death of his first wife .
james carver , who represents herefordshire and worcestershire in the european parliament , lost his first wife , carmen , to scleroderma disease in 2009 , when she was just 42 .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: sport therapy students at top basketball club in spain
text: students from the university of worcester got an insight into sports therapy at elite level with a placement at a top basketball club in spain .

sports therapy students katie cousins , rebecca gwilliam and charlotte byde , left to right at their stadium in spain , spent time working with the players under supervision behind the scenes at valencia basket club , which plays in the liga acb and euroleague .
the university said this was possible thanks to the partnership agreement between the university , which owns the worcester wolves basketball side , and the current spanish champions .

documents.title: travel : trains delayed and cancelled
text: rail passengers travelling between birmingham and redditch are warned to expect delays on london midland services .
the train company says `` road transport has been ordered '' .
1/2 services between birmingham new street to redditch are not running at the moment due to signalling issues .
travel west midlands
great
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: preparations for new road classical concert
text: construction workers have been completing the stage in worcester for saturday 's last night of the new road proms .
new road has been a hive of activity today as construction workers complete the stage for saturday 's 'last night of the new road proms '

documents.title: teenager sets up mental health charity
text: a teenager has set up a charity which aims to use music and dance to help people with mental health difficulties .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: 'fan racially abused player '
text: police are investigating an allegation that a fan racially abused a redditch united player during their away game at kettering town .
more than 600 people were at the match on tuesday , when a redditch player reported to the referee that a racial slur had been made against him by a home supporter .
the individual was evicted from the grounds by stewards and police say they 're treating it as a hate crime .
kettering town said they operate `` a zero tolerance approach to such behaviour and it has been reported to northamptonshire police '' .
they added : `` the club apologises to redditch united , the player involved and everyone else present and assure you all that we are dealing with this matter . ''
author: Anna Russell
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: scarecrows back for annual event
text: a competition will be held for the best scarecrow character in an initiative linked to a museum 's annual scarecrow day this bank holiday .
visitors to forge mill can have a go at making some colourful characters as part of an event organised by redditch borough council .
special scarecrow-making days have been arranged for 23 and 24 august .
to take part visitors need to turn up on the day with some old clothes and pay £ 3 for the `` ingredients '' to bring a scarecrow to life , the council said .
the characters will be judged on sunday 27 august at the scarecrow day event , which includes scarecrow making , children 's activities , pony rides , face painting , craft stalls and music .

documents.title: drink driver arrested after crash in st james road , malvern
text: police arrested a driver for drink driving after a crash involving two vehicles .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: a-level results : 'record ' for malvern school
text: a worcesterhire school has hailed its `` outstanding '' sixth form following `` record '' results .

the chase in malvern said nearly a third of all of its entries resulted in either an a or a grade with `` a record 18 % achieving aab in at least 2 facilitating subjects '' - the subjects `` normally required '' to get into the top universities .
changes to the qualifications system in england mean 13 a-level subjects this year have been decided solely by final exams , with no link to coursework or as-levels .
the school said results `` are perhaps even more remarkable considering the increased demand and challenge of the newly reformed a levels which were sat for the first time this year '' .
leading the way was christopher wright , who achieved four a grades , which helped to secure his place at oxford to study maths .

head teacher mike fieldhouse said the school was delighted with the performance of all of its sixth-form students and believed a record number of them had secured a place at their first-choice university or on a higher-level apprenticeship .

documents.title: war hero 's gravestone restored after vandalism
text: the gravestone of a world war one soldier buried in powick has been restored after the original was vandalised by thieves .
cyril william finch lived in callow end and drowned during the war as he tried to save a comrade .
a 2ft-tall stone angel was cut from its base on the grave , but thanks to the local royal engineers association and the commonwealth war graves commission the headstone has been repaired .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: clark among replacements for world cup match
text: worcester valkyries ' vastly experienced prop , rochelle clark , has been named among the replacements for england women for today 's world cup match against the usa in dublin .
head coach simon middleton has made six changes .
sarah hunter returns to captain the side at number eight .
both teams are unbeaten , with the winners automatically qualifying for next week 's semi-finals .
the match kicks off at billings park at 14:30 .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: beer , cider and perry festival at worcester
text: more than 11,000 people are expected at worcester racecourse over the next three days for city 's beer , cider and perry festival .
visitors will be able to sample more than 100 draught ciders and perrys as well as more than 170 real ales .
people anticipate the date being declared for next year and there 's great excitement on facebook when we announced when the dates are and tickets go on sale .
so , yeah , i think people do enjoy coming to the festival . ''

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : joy and despair over a-levels
text: on midlands today this lunchtime , we 'll be getting reaction to today 's a-level results across the region .
the first students to sit one of the new a-level exams have been learning how they did and we 'll also be hearing how west midlands ' universities are coping with the clearing process .
plenty to come on bbc one from 13:30 .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: memorial restored after council help
text: the names of dozens of men from hereford who were killed in world war one can now be read for the first time in decades .
raf veteran david williams was angry the names on the holmer parish memorial were fading away so he asked the city council if it could help .
it funded the restoration by cathedral stonemason simon hudson and a rededication service is planned for later this year .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: rspca warning after cats and dog die from poisoning in leominster
text: pet owners are being warned about the dangers of pesticides and chemicals after two cats and a dog died from poisoning in leominster .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: top a-level grades edge upwards
text: top a-level grades have increased for the first time in six years , as teenagers in england , wales and northern ireland get their results .
changes to the qualifications system in england mean 13 a-level subjects this year have been decided solely by final exams , with no link to coursework or as-levels .
there are claims that 's contributed to a 4 % drop in the number applying for university places .
pro vice-chancellor at the university of worcester ross renton says they 'll be happy to hear from any students who 've changed their minds now they 've got their grades .
there [ are ] areas where we are expanding - so for example , teaching and nursing .
we 're really keen to hear from people that are interested in those professions . ''
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: dukes pink ball : what the players think of the latest innovation
text: england take on the west indies at edgbaston today in the first day-night test in england .
the teams will be wearing traditional white clothing but using a pink dukes ball .
but that ball has split opinion .
after practicing under the edgbaston lights on monday , england all-rounder moeen ali acknowledged that the pink ball is `` different '' .
he added : `` it feels lighter off the bat .
sometimes you do n't feel like you 've hit it and it goes ; other times you 've nailed it and it does n't .
but you get used to it .
i did by the end of the session . ''
warwickshire coach ashley giles said that on day one of the day-night match against lancashire in june there were `` a couple of incidents where guys were not sure where the ball had gone '' .
however , durham all-rounder paul collingwood , was less positive after making 25 off the pink ball in a rain-affected draw against worcestershire in june .
he described it as `` shocking '' and `` like plastic when you hit it '' .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: haywood lane in hereford re-opened following crash
text: haywood lane in hereford has now re-opened following a crash this morning .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: 'idiot ' risks life at level crossing
text: a young man who threw himself under a railway level crossing barrier in a bid to beat a train has been branded an `` idiot '' by users on social media .

video of the youth diving under the barriers in blakedown , worcestershire , was released by network rail , with a spokesperson saying he had `` little respect for his own safety or the safety of others by doing this irresponsible act '' .
the crossing on station drive is regularly `` misused '' network rail said by both pedestrians and vehicles , some of which have been seen weaving around the barriers even as they werre falling .

documents.title: weather watchers : redditch
text: this photo of redditch was sent in by mollies meadow .
you can get involved at bbc weather watchers .

documents.title: rhodes reflects on t20 blast defeat
text: worcestershire director of cricket steve rhodes says they `` should n't be too ashamed '' in losing to lancashire in the t20 blast at old trafford .
jos buttler struck 52 from 40 balls as lancashire lightning beat the rapids by seven wickets .
the visitors made 127-8 and the home side won with 15 balls to spare .
we were about 15 runs short of a par score .
so it was going to be difficult especially against a decent lancashire side we should n't be too ashamed in losing to them .
they 've got six international players in their side .
we 've got one . ''
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: woman thanks staff at worcestershire royal hospital
text: a woman who collapsed at home following a mystery illness has thanked the `` angels '' at a worcester hospital who saved her life .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: 'more wage-dodging employers out there '
text: responding to the national list of `` wage-dodging employers '' , tuc general secretary frances o'grady said the union was convinced there were other firms breaching the law which had n't yet been caught .
`` tuc research suggests there are at least a quarter of a million workers being cheated out of the minimum wage , '' she said .
the current rate for the national living wage is £ 7.50 per hour .
the adult rate for the national minimum wage is £ 7.05 for those between 21 and 24 .

documents.title: haywood lane in hereford blocked in both directions
text: haywood lane in hereford is currently blocked in both directions .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: minimum wage offenders named and shamed
text: three worcestershire employers have been fined by the government for failing to pay staff the minimum wage .
alsigns commercials in broadway , nightingales of kidderminster and his and hers hair salon in redditch were all found to have under paid workers .
nationally , 233 firms were given fines , with the catalogue retailer argos failing to pay a total of almost £ 1.5m to more than 12,000 staff .

documents.title: worcestershire struggle again in t20 blast
text: it was another t20 match to forget for worcestershire rapids , who lost by seven wickets at lancashire , despite captain joe leach hitting 24 from 15 balls .
economical bowling from lancashire lightning spinner stephen parry restricted the visitors to 127-8 .

from then on england international joss butler showed his class , striking 52 from 40 balls as he shared a 76-run partnership with fellow england international liam livingstone ( 36 ) to help reach their target with 15 balls to spare .

documents.title: watch : today 's weather in 54 seconds
text: it 's been a wet start for many of us in the west midlands - here 's how the rest of thursday is looking .
you can also find the latest forecasts at any other time on the bbc weather website .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

text: welcome to herefordshire and worcestershire live on thursday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .

text: buttler masterclass inspires lancashire win

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: cricket : live commentary - lightning v rapids
text: i 'll be bringing you full ball-by-ball commentary as the worcestershire rapids travel to old trafford to take on lancashire lightning in the t20 blast .
you can hear the match on bbc hereford & worcester 's 738am frequency and online .
author: Dave Bradley
Cricket commentator

documents.title: source of pet poisoning unknown
text: it 's still not been established whether two cats and a dog who died were poisoned `` accidentally or deliberately '' , the rspca says .
the charity is warning people about the the dangers of antifreeze , pesticides and chemicals after the pets died in hereford this week .
a number of animals have also died after ingesting an unknown substance in sand pits in leominster , the rspca said .
it has been confirmed by a vet that the animals had consumed something poisonous , but what we do not know is if this was accidental or deliberate .
if someone is doing this to prevent cats coming into their garden it is a very selfish and inhumane way to deal with the issue . ''

documents.title: unemployment up in the west midlands
text: unemployment went up by 5.8 % across the west midlands in the three months to june , according to data .
figures from the ons show 164,000 people are registered as out of work across the region - an increase of 3,000 people compared with the first three months of the year .
author: Monica Rimmer
Journalist, BBC Online

documents.title: slideshow : canals and rivers on a summer day
text: the summer weather has encouraged these bbc weather watchers to get out and about with their cameras .
thanks to happy snapper , willworcs , punxsutawney phil and paul wilde for these photos .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: skies will cloud over this evening as rain erratically moves east with brisk winds .
rain will continue overnight , with some heavy bursts at times .
however , rain will start to clear towards dawn .
lows of 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: award for bulls ' groundsman
text: the groundsman at hereford fc 's edgar street ground has received an award for the quality of the pitches he prepares .
ben bowen has been named runner up in the southern league south and west groundsman of the year award .

documents.title: watch : youth 'risks life ' at level crossing
text: video showing a young man throwing himself under the barriers to avoid a train at a level crossing in blakedown , worcestershire , has been released by network rail .
a spokesman said the youth had `` little respect for his own safety or the safety of others by doing this irresponsible act '' .
network rail say the crossing on station drive is `` regularly misused '' , including vehicles weaving around and hitting the barriers and pedestrians jumping the barriers after they were lowered .

documents.title: your apples and summer blooms
text: these summery come from bbc weather watcher fuzzballpc .
i 'd love to feature your photos - you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: cricket : moeen in squad for first 'pink ball ' test
text: moeen ali will get the chance to bowl with the new pink ball as england play their first day/night test against the west indies , which starts tomorrow at edgbaston .
the worcestershire all-rounder was man of the series in the four tests against south africa .
moeen ali confirmed in england side for day-night test v west indies at edgbaston starting tomorrow
great news - will he be a @ twitterid player next year though ?
i would hope so , the main man is on a roll , best we have at the moment !
legend

documents.title: rural crime costs herefordshire £ 735,000
text: rural crime cost herefordshire £ 735,000 in 2016 , a new report by insurance firm nfu mutual has revealed .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: museum shop moves to guildhall during revamp
text: the museum of royal worcester , which celebrates the history of porcelain making in the city , is closing for a major refurbishment in october .
the £ 1.4m lottery-funded project will see the social history of worcester porcelain brought to life , using interactive displays and audio recordings of former workers at the factory .
so that the museum does n't lose income during the five-month revamp , the city council is allowing it to move its shop to the ground floor of the north wing of the guildhall , rent free .
the museum 's trustees are deeply grateful to the city for this generous offer , the shop on the high street will ensure our presence throughout the refurbishment of the museum itself . ''

documents.title: 'takeaway ' cat put on diet by rescue centre
text: a stray cat who had grown obese living off left-over takeaways in a park has been put on a strict diet by a rescue centre .
the five-year-old stray , who 's been named sandy , was taken to the blue cross rescue centre after being found living wild in sanders park , bromsgrove .
she weighed a heafty 7kg ( 15lbs ) when found .
the rescue centre has put her on a `` no treats '' diet , with a target weight of 5kg ( 11lbs ) .
they are also gradually building up the amount of exercise she takes , as she tires easily because of her weight .
i have n't seen a cat so overweight in a long time .
while we do n't know how she became a stray or what she got up to during that time , it is likely she has been surviving on scraps of human food like takeaways .
because of her weight she has not been able to carry out normal cat behaviour like grooming and playing but we are aiming to get her back to her proper cat self in no time . ''

documents.title: your nature up close
text: these great were taken by paul wilde in the abbey meadows , redditch .

documents.title: travel : historic bridge to close for repairs
text: the bridge , which is a scheduled ancient monument , was built in 1728 , according to historic england .
eckington bridge will be closed 21st - 25th aug to repair damage .
pedestrians and cyclists will still be able to use the bridge
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: balloon championships : too windy to fly
text: there 'll be no flying in the national hot air balloon championships in worcestershire this evening , because it 's too windy .
the event is being held in wolverley , near kidderminster , all week with 17 pilots competing in navigation exercises each morning and evening .

documents.title: five music festivals this weekend
text: there 's a wealth of live music available across herefordshire and worcestershire this weekend :

documents.title: feedback reveals children 's services and big projects are people 's main concerns
text: more than 1,000 people have gone to roadshows held by worcestershire county council to have their say on the authority 's services .
the future of children 's services and investment in big infrastructure problems are the major issues people have raised , the council says .
the council has held six roadshows so far , with another three to come .
they have proved , yet again , to be a great way for us to engage with our residents and find out what they think of the services we run

documents.title: kidderminster park event is to celebrate the life of popular mr tee
text: a day of music and family fun at a kidderminster park will celebrate the life of horsefair 's popular mr tee .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: slideshow : corn fields and summer clouds
text: the continuing sunshine means bbc weather watchers have been out and about taking some great photos .
thanks to happysnapper71 , j at severn ridge , toppo and andy r for this selection .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: bromsgrove advertiser back page : smith praises troops
text: paul smith praised the manner in which his bromsgrove sporting players have started the season .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: grants available for volunteer and community groups
text: voluntary and community groups are being encouraged to apply for stronger community grants of up to £ 500 from redditch borough council .
the council grants aim to support local , community-focused projects .
our town has a really strong sense of community and this is in no small part due to the work carried out by organisations and voluntary groups who dedicate their time and skills . ''

documents.title: hot air balloon championships : using the wind
text: the british national hot air balloon championships are being held in worcestershire over the next four days .
competitors from all over the country will take part in a navigational exercise over what one of the organisers called `` a 3d playing field '' .
the competitions start from wolverley school , near kidderminster .
we 've been set four tasks - we fly the balloons between four set points along the route .
the winds vary by about 30 or 40 degrees and we are using these winds to take us to four points between wolverley and upper arley

documents.title: bromsgrove advertiser front page : new train services on track
text: new train services are being promised through bromsgrove after london midland lost its operations contract - but fares could increase by 3.6 % .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: man suffers 'serious injuries ' in assault
text: a man in his 40s has been taken to hospital after suffering `` serious injuries '' in an assault .
west mercia police say the attack happened yesterday evening at an address in thorn lea , evesham .
police say a 23-year-old man from evesham has been arrested on sus of grievous bodily harm .
three men , a 24-year-old man from evesham , a 28-year-old man from birmingham and a 45-year-old man from birmingham , have been arrested on sus of aggravated burglary .

documents.title: your stately gardens from the air
text: thanks to dave bright , of bright skies videos , for this aerial shot of croome gardens , in worcestershire .
i 'd love to feature your - they do n't have to be taken in mid air - you can email , tweet us @ twitterid or message via facebook .

documents.title: cricket : rapids in action at old trafford
text: worcestershire rapids are back in action this evening when they take on lancashire lightning in the t20 blast at old trafford .
play is due to begin at 18:30 and i 'll be bringing you full commentary on bbc hereford & worcester 's 738am frequency and online .
author: Dave Bradley
Cricket commentator

documents.title: campaigners call for roundabout at notorious crossroads
text: furious pershore residents have begun a campaign for a roundabout at a notorious junction , which they say would ease traffic misery .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: watch : up , up and away : air balloon championships
text: hot air balloon enthusiasts from all over the uk are in north worcestershire this week for the british national hot air balloon championships .
i 've been to watch some of the competitors as they take to the air .
author: Phil Maiden
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: mp tweets on trump 's 'both sides to blame ' comment
text: bromsgrove mp and government minister , sajid javid , has tweeted his own comment on president trump saying both sides are to blame for the violent unrest in charlottesville , virginia , which left one protester dead and others injured .
neo-nazis : bad anti-nazis : good i learned that as a child .
it was pretty obvious .
exclusive : theresa may 's historic links to nazi sympathiser uncovered .
what links are those he condemned violence on both sides ffs
there is only one side when comes to nazis .
nazis or not nazis .
so the armed masked flag burning monument destroyers antifafa are not behaving like nazis ?
oh dear you need to grow up and see outside
so you 're equating vandalism to fascism
no violently silencing those who they disagree with makes antifa fascist
did that make the allies fascists when they violently silenced the nazis ?
neo-nazis : bad anti-nazi mobs who beat up anyone they suspect of being a neo-nazi : also bad
yes those guys doing nazi salutes and chanting 'blood and soil ' while parading with torches round a black church could 've been anyone
criticising one group does n't mean you support the opposit view .
the immediate aftermath of a nazi rally in which nazis murdered a woman is not the time for this , if there 's ever a time for it
has to be seen in the context of a bigger though obviously .
the bigger sure , there 's the group that supports genocide and the group that opposes them .
that 's the bigger
antifa have a very broad definition of who 's a fascist .
it includes journalists for a start .
it 's fair to say the people carrying nazi flags , doing nazi salutes and shouting 'jews will not replace us ' at the weekend were fascists .
and then you grew up and realised the # altleft were even more wicked , right ?
i ca n't believe what i 'm reading .
are you supporting trump and david duke here ?
not at all , i 'm saying the alt-left are violent extremists too .
5 policemen murdered in dallas & obama did n't condemn them .
are you saying there is moral equivalence ?
i 'm saying , evil is evil no matter who or which group it is
so there is moral equivalency between the kkk , nazis and heather heyer ?
do n't twist my words .
u r what happened in charlottesville has to be condemned in the strongest terms but we should also call out other evil acts similarly

text: here are the results of last night 's games involving our local teams :

there are some blue skies about , as this photo from bbc weather watcher , maggs , shows .

documents.title: slideshow : bows and flows of angel 's hair
text: that 's how joni mitchell saw clouds - this is how bbc weather watchers have been seeing them in the summer sky today .
thanks to punxsautawney pete , chris and ginny , mollie and janiejane for this selection .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: 'lotto gran ' death : 'not sus say police
text: the death of susanne hinte , dubbed lottery gran by the tabloids , is not being treated as sus
ms hinte , who was 49 , hit the headlines when she claimed a possible £ 33m winning lottery ticket had been ruined in the wash. camelot later confirmed somebody else as the winner .
west midlands ambulance service say they were called to an address in worcester at 17:35 yesterday `` to reports of a woman in cardiac arrest '' .
nothing could be done and she died at the scene , a spokeswoman said .

documents.title: weather : another fine day forecast for tomorrow
text: if you enjoyed the sunny weather today then we 're forecast more of the same tomorrow , with temperatures reaching around 21c ( 70f ) again .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: false claim 'lotto gran ' dies at home
text: false claim 'lotto gran ' dies at home

documents.title: new starting point announced for carnival parade
text: this year 's stourport carnival parade will start from the redstone caravan park on the rough , the event 's organisers have announced .
no alcohol will be allowed on the carnival field , they say .

documents.title: 'less time on contracts , more on patients ' promises trust
text: streamlining bureaucracy and performance targets will mean a hospital trust can concentrate on cutting waiting times , it says .

the wye valley nhs trust , which looks after herefordshire 's hospitals , has promised there will be `` less focus on contractual arrangements and more effort put into making sure local people receive the best care and treatment possible '' .

a new agreement between the trust and the local clinical commissioning group guarantees a fixed level of income for the year - hospitals will also get an extra £ 2.9m which will be used to cut waiting lists .

documents.title: cycle festival raises money for people with dementia
text: evesham 's annual cyclefest will be fundraising for the alzheimer 's society as one of its chosen charities , organisers say .
olympic medallist chris boardman will be leading the sportive ride , one of the main events in the festival , which takes place on 2 and 3 september .
cyclefest was launched in 2014 to raise funds for the evesham bell tower appeal .
the other chosen charity this year is the worcestershire young onset dementia service .
the money raised will fund valuable research into dementia and support for those currently living with the condition

documents.title: 'lotto gran ' dies : susanne hinte 's time in the tabloids
text: susanne hinte , who was 49 and from worcester , was dubbed `` lotto gran '' by the tabloids in january last year after claiming a possible £ 33m winning lottery ticket was ruined in the wash .
she believed she had the winning numbers ( but camelot confirmed somebody else as the winner .
ms hinte told the bbc this led to a `` life of misery '' as she was accused of trying to fraudulently claim the money .
her daughter confirmed today that ms hinte had died , but that the cause of death was unknown .
a year later a former friend was given a suspended six-week jail term at worcester magistrates ' court for selling intimate of her to a national newspaper .

documents.title: illegal cigarettes seized from hereford shop
text: supersam in eign street was searched on july 23 by herefordshire trading standards and west mercia police .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: football : full commentary on harriers and bulls
text: you can hear full commentary on both the games involving kidderminster harriers and hereford fc as part of match night special after 19:00 this evening on bbc hereford & worcester .
harriers head into tonight 's home match against leamington looking to make it two successive vanarama north wins .
hereford will play their first home game of the season when they take on tiverton town at edgar street .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: three in court on petrol station robbery charges
text: three men have appeared in court on robbery and drugs charges following a raid at a petrol station in great witley on 1 august , police say .
west mercia police says two 19-year-olds and an 18-year-old , all from wolverhampton , appeared at worcester magistrates ' court on saturday .
they are next due to appear again in court on 9 september .

documents.title: breaking'lotto gran ' dies
text: the worcester woman who tried to claim a £ 33m lottery jackpot with a ticket she said she 'd damaged in the wash has died .
the daughter of 49-year-old susanne hinte ( has told the bbc the cause of her mother 's death has n't been confirmed and a post-mortem examination is still due to be carried out .

documents.title: gold for five-year-old at transplant games
text: a five-year-old girl has won a gold medal at the british transplant games as part of a team from birmingham children 's hospital .
imogen raxter , from droitwich , who 's had a liver transplant at the hospital , won the `` best child aged five and under '' title at the games .

documents.title: slideshow : blue skies and ripe fruit
text: as the weather takes a turn for the better , bbc weather watchers have been out and about getting some great photos .
thanks to j at seven ridge , toppo , geoff , budster and maria for this selection .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: staff member threatened during carphone warehouse robbery
text: a member of staff was grabbed and `` threatened with violence '' as two men stole phones from a shop on a retail park , police say .
west mercia police says the robbery took place at carphone warehouse , on the malvern retail park , at about 18:20 yesterday .

documents.title: india 's ashwin joins worcestershire
text: india 's ashwin joins worcestershire

documents.title: man uses chainsaw to free himself after tree falls on him
text: a gamekeeper who had to use a chainsaw to free himself after a tree he was working on fell on to him says it 's vital people who are working alone , as he was , let someone know where they are .
kieron robbins , from abberley , in worcestershire , was airlifted to the worcestershire royal hospital with a broken ankle after the accident last week .
he says before he thought of using the chainsaw to free himself , he was concerned he might not be found .

when i could n't get the phone out of my pocket i did think automatically there and then 'this is it ' nobody knew i was there [ and ] the point i 'd like to make is if you are going to work somewhere alone , let somebody know where you are
author: Phil Maiden
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: meadows appeal : 97 % of uk flood plain meadows lost
text: flood plain meadows in south worcestershire which a wildlife trust has begun an appeal to buy are some of the last in the uk .
worcestershire wildlife trust says the country has lost about 97 % of such meadows over the past 70 years and flood plain meadows such as the one at hardwick green are rarer still .
the meadows , in south worcestershire , are home to endangered plants including the great burnet .
there are just 3,500 acres of flood plain meadow left in the uk - that 's only the size of heathrow airport .
hardwick green meadows represent 1.5 % of these meadows , so it 's vital that they are saved for the future

documents.title: man impaled on railings
text: a man has been airlifted to hospital with chest injuries after getting impaled on iron railings , west midlands ambulance service says .
it said it was called to church bank in wolverley , worcestershire , just after 10:30 today .
the injured man , in his 40s , was conscious and in a stable condition when airlifted to the queen elizabeth hospital in birmingham , a spokesperson said .

documents.title: meadows appeal : how much money is needed ?
text: an appeal has been launched by worcestershire wildlife trust to raise the money to buy `` important flood plain meadows '' in the south of the county
hardwick green meadows are home to rare plants and wildlife including otters , brown hares and barn owls .

documents.title: more money to tackle hospital waiting lists
text: almost £ 3m is to be spent in herefordshire to help the trust running the county 's hospitals tackle waiting lists .
the trust will also be working more closely with the county 's clinical commissioning group and is promising to get rid of red tape .
bosses say the trust 's newly created accountable care system means services can be tailored to meet the needs of individual communities .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: wildlife trust starts £ 50k appeal to buy flood plain meadows
text: a wildlife trust has begun an appeal to buy `` important flood plain meadows '' in south worcestershire .

worcestershire wildlife trust has already raised £ 25,000 towards the cost of buying hardwick green meadows , near the village of eldersfield , in the shadow of the malvern hills ( it needs another £ 50,000 .
the fields are currently owned by the esmee fairbairn foundation , which agreed to buy them on a short-term basis to give the trust time to raise the necessary funds .
the trust says the meadows are home to rare plants and wildlife including barn owls , brown hares and otters .

documents.title: cricket : moeen getting better and better , says vaughan
text: the former england captain michael vaughan says moeen ali is getting better and better as a test cricketer .
the worcestershire all-rounder was named player of the series after the recent tests against south africa - he took 25 wickets and scored 252 runs in the four test series .
moeen 's bowling throughout this series and for a while now , it 's been getting better and better

documents.title: kemp hos founder passes away
text: one of the founders of kemp hos and a popular kidderminster reverend has died , at the age of 82 .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: what 's that helicopter doing flying so low ?
text: if you see a helicopter flying low over hereford today , do n't worry - it 's checking overhead electricity lines for western power distribution .
they love you to take photos of their chopper in the air , which they can tweet .
we 're flying in # hereford # ludlow # withybush # brecon # somerset and # devon today .
pics thanks to @ twitterid # wpdspotted

documents.title: your balloon in the blue skies
text: the weather is looking set fair today - bbc weather watcher , gill , took this of some people in a balloon over kidderminster taking advantage of the sunshine and blue skies .
i 'd love to feature your photos - you can email , tweet us @ twitterid or message via facebook .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: sir roy strong 's laskett gardens to open for hos event
text: herefordshire is home to one of the largest private formal gardens to have been created in england since the second world war - and the gates are set to open to raise money for st michael 's hos
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: watch : craft workers ' businesses 'threatened by knife ban '
text: a redditch woodworker is warning plans to ban online sales of knives will force craftsmen like him out of business and wo n't halt a rise in crime .
new government proposals would mean bladed weapons could n't be delivered to private addresses and would have to be bought in person .
richard weaver makes his own carving tools .
he fears they 'd be included in any ban .
author: James Pearson
Political reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: cricket : herefordshire need a quick strike
text: herefordshire county cricket club are going to need to take the final wicket quickly this morning and then produce a very solid batting performance if they are to win their unicorns championship match against wales at eastnor .
wales will resume their second inning this morning on 209 for 9 - a lead of 257 runs .
herefordshire all-rounder peter burgoyne has taken 4-28 in 17 overs .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast for the west midlands
text: it will be a much drier and brighter day on the whole with a low risk of catching a brief shower .
there will be plenty of sunny spells and it will feel warm in the sunshine - highs of 23c ( 73f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from today 's herefordshire and worcestershire live page
text: welcome to the local live service for herefordshire and worcestershire on tuesday morning .
i 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us @ twitterid or message via facebook .
author: Jerry Chester
BBC News Online

documents.title: farmers 'under siege ' from thieves
text: farmers 'under siege ' from thieves

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: aggravated burglary in herefordshire
text: west mercia police are investigating a burglary in which an elderly couple were assaulted with a metal bar in weobley .
two men forced their way into the property in the early hours of saturday morning before attacking the couple , in their 80s , and demanding cash .
the offenders fled the scene empty-handed when the victims told them they were pensioners with no money to steal .
the couple was taken to hospital to be treated for head and hand injuries .
this is an unprovoked and wholly unnecessary attack on vulnerable victims .
i would like to reassure the community of weobley that incidents of this nature are rare and we have increased uniform patrols in the area to offer reassurance . ''

documents.title: weather : heavy rain tonight and some showers tomorrow
text: we 're forecast some heavy rain tonight , but it will be a much better day tomorrow , with just a few showers expected .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: application for helipad at worcestershire royal
text: more than 60 extra parking spaces could be created at worcestershire royal hospital - as well as a helicopter landing pad .
the hospital has applied to worcester city council for planning permission for the helipad and 61 new staff spaces opposite the oncology unit .
the helipad will allow patients who are airlifted to the hospital to enter the main building directly , instead of being transferred in via an ambulance from a temporary structure nearby .
a decision over planning permission will be made by october .
author: Anna Russell
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: bromsgrove youngster to take on 17-mile charity walk
text: a determined 11-year-old from bromsgrove is putting his best foot forward to raise money for a charity close to his heart .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: reservoir visitors told to steer clear of algae
text: the canal & river trust is advising visitors to upper and lower bittell reservoirs in north worcestershire to avoid unnecessary contact with the water due to blue-green algae , the toxicity of which is uncertain .
warning signs have been placed around the affected areas .

documents.title: police record more than 100 crimes involving drones in three months
text: in the three months from 1 april to 30 june the police recorded more than 100 crimes involving drones over shropshire , herefordshire , worcestershire and warwickshire .
the majority involved drones flying over properties , but there were also two reports of drones being shot at , seven of drones flying over prisons and one of a drone flying over a police station .
warwickshire police recorded 30 incidents in that period and west mercia police 80 .
and there were reports of drones crashing into gardens and sports fields and one of an owner trespassing to recover their drone .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: wife 'should not have to prove unreasonable behaviour '
text: lawyers representing a worcestershire woman who wants a divorce say she should not have to prove `` unreasonable '' behaviour by her husband .
tini owens , from broadway , is taking her fight to divorce her husband of nearly 40 years , hugh owens , to the supreme court after it was denied by both a family court and the court of appeal .
her barristers say she should only have to prove her husband 's behaviour was such that she could not reasonably be expected to live with him .
mr owens says he does n't want a divorce .
no date has yet been set for the supreme court hearing .

documents.title: couple raise £ 5k in memory of kidderminster gp
text: a chaddesley corbett couple have raised £ 5,000 for the meningitis research foundation in memory of their kidderminster doctor john spalding , who died from the disease .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: '20 lives in 20 days ' - a wheelchair world record attempt
text: a charity fund-raiser is pushing himself through herefordshire today - as he attempts to set a new world record for travelling from land 's end to john o'groats in a wheelchair .
the current record is 29 days , but shaun is hoping to do it in 20 .

he 's stopping off along the way to talk to local people , organisations and businesses and asking them to commit to doing something positive in their communities , to change people 's lives for the better .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: worcestershire business park evacuated
text: saxon business park in stoke prior , worcestershire , has been evacuated and closed off following a gas leak .
west midlands ambulance service says it was caused by a lorry hitting a gas main .
a 200m cordon is in place .
no injuries have been reported but the ambulance service is on standby to respond .

documents.title: nhs payout following kidderminster death
text: two nhs trusts - including the one that runs worcestershire 's acute hospitals - have agreed a financial payout with the family of a kidderminster man who died of soft tissue cancer in 2014 .
before 27-year-old daniel hemmings died in 2014 , he began a legal battle claiming doctors had failed to inform him after surgery he had a malignant tumour .
the two hospitals have now agreed an unknown payout .
it was daniel himself that originally started the case back in august 2012 .
there 's been some long delays but finally it all came to a head , which is a relief . ''
author: Phil Maiden
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: thieves taking animals as well a farm equipment
text: farmer dave greenow , from hereford , says rural crime has cost him about £ 20,000 over the past five years , including theft of equipment and even sheep and cows .
he said soaring insurance premiums had caused him to just `` swallow the pill '' and pay to replace items himself .
he said in the case of his stolen sheep he believed they had been taken to an abattoir before any distinguishing marks removed .
i think they [ the police ] need to take it a bit more serious .
if they just turned up , it 's amazing what they could do .
in the case of my steam cleaner which was stolen , we had cctv coverage and they did n't turn up for three weeks . ''

documents.title: malvern brain tumour man kayaks along the wye
text: a malvern man with a brain tumour is marking his 100th cycle of chemotherapy by kayaking 100 miles along the river wye .
ben lindon is hoping to raise thousands of pounds for the charity brain tumour research by taking on challenges such as running marathons , cycling across the country and climbing mountains .
when ben was diagnosed , he was told that he would n't have children and he was expected to live just five more years .
nine years later , he 's the proud dad of two children and is determined to raise as much money as he can to fund research into the disease .

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : the rising cost of rural crime
text: on midlands today this lunchtime , we 're reporting on the cost of rural crime as new figures show there 's been a 20 % rise across the west midlands in the first six months of this year .
criminals are targeting tools , 4x4s and livestock and we 'll have a look at what 's being done to try and reverse that trend on bbc one from 13:30 .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: delays of 90 minutes on m5
text: motorists on the m5 northbound approaching wychbold face delays of up to 90 minutes , highways england is warning .
two lanes are closed j5-j4aa due to a broken down vehicle .
recovery vehicles are on the way , highways england says .
severedelays on the # m5 northbound btwn j5 - j4a due to a broken down vehicle closing 2 lanes .
recovery crews are on the way
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: beadle expects better from hereford
text: hereford fc 's manager pete beadle has made it clear to his players he expects them to up their game for tomorrow 's home game against tiverton town .
the bulls opened their season with a 3-3 draw at kings langley - and beadle says that 's not good enough .
i do n't know where it 's come from because pre-season we 've played some great games .
no disrespect to kings langley - we 've played some better opposition and we 've come out of it with flying colours . ''

documents.title: funding boost helps save 'at-risk ' church
text: a herefordshire church has received a £ 12,000 grant to help fund urgent repairs .
the national churches trust gave the money to st mary 's church in staunton-on-wye so it can carry out work on the tower , roof , windows and stonework .
the building , which is thought to date from norman times , is currently on historic england 's heritage at risk register - but it 's hoped the repairs will enable it to come off the list .

the congregation and community of staunton-on-wye are delighted at the generosity of this grant , which will greatly support us in meeting the large sum required for the restoration and repair of st mary 's church .
we are also looking forward to developing proper facilities in the church which will both attract and provide for everyone who comes to this lovely building . ''

documents.title: left-handed children 'penalised '
text: children are still being penalised for being left handed , according to campaigners in worcester .

local mps and the owner of the city 's left handed shop say they 're frustrated by the government 's lack of progress in developing teacher training and data - and fear the disproportionate number of left-handed people in prison suggests a `` downward spiral '' which begins in the classroom .
the mp for worcester robin walker has written to the education minister nick gibb about the issue .
this should be so easy to sort .
it 's of extreme importance and will cost nothing to address - not a penny it 's so easy to do .
it 's about where you sit kids in class , how they hold their pen , it 's really easy and nothing happens . ''

documents.title: eighteen months to know if £ 40k treatment worked
text: a kidderminster woman who travelled to russia for potentially groundbreaking treatment for her multiple sclerosis says she might not know if it 's been successful for another year and a half .
janet voyce had to raise £ 40,000 to fund stem cell treatment in moscow and has just arrived back in england .
the chemotherapy appears to have done its job .
i have the very best possibility that that has been successful .
what i have to do now is hope that the disease has actually been halted .
it 's a long time before i know that with more certainty . ''

documents.title: more free meals needed for children
text: the leader of a worcestershire group that offers free meals to children during the school holidays says there are n't enough places providing a similar service .
there are more than 10,000 children in herefordshire and worcestershire who claim free school meals .
but david boucker , who runs a pie and play club providing free hot meals at evesham adventure playground , says parents can really struggle when free school meals are n't there .
never enough places around ; we have a lot of support from local people .
it 's about pulling together as a community , and that 's what we 've always done . ''
author: Phil Maiden
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: warriors - encouraging start to season
text: worcester warriors ' head coach carl hogg says there some encouraging signs from the side 's opening pre-season match against hartpury .
the warriors won 55-21 as they ran in nine tries .
there were some really good things out there , i thought our endeavour was really high , and a really high work rate - but there 's obviously one or two bits we need to put right going forward . ''

documents.title: herefordshire men finish second in 444-mile river kayak race
text: two members of hereford kayak club have sailed their way through a 444-mile kayak and canoe race and finished second overall .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: cricket - worcestershire need to up their game
text: worcestershire 's director of cricket steve rhodes says the team needs to move on from the weekend 's t20 blast defeat .
the rapids were beaten by 11 runs by nottinghamshire outlaws at new road yesterday .
it was a decent day for alex hepburn though , taking 5 for 24 .
we 've got a couple of games left and we want to get maximum points in those two games . ''

documents.title: man charged after drugs bust
text: a man has been charged with the production of cannabis after a police raid on a property in worcester .
plants with a street value of thousands of pounds have been seized .
the man was also charged with possession of a fraudulent passport , police said .

documents.title: man told to pay compensation after fracturing officer 's finger during arrest
text: a man who fractured a police officer 's finger claimed he did n't remember the incident due to drinking alcohol while prescribed strong pain killers , magistrates heard .
author: Ledbury Reporter

documents.title: rural crime costs counties £ 1.8m
text: worcestershire is one of the worst affected counties when it comes to rural crime , according to an insurer .
nfu mutual 's latest rural crime report shows the problem cost people in herefordshire and worcestershire just over £ 1.8m last year .
in worcestershire , the problem cost just over £ 1m , a rise of 28.8 % on the previous year .

tim price , from nfu mutual , said the decision to stop producing land rover defenders last year had caused their prices to soar , meaning thieves were targeting them , both to sell-on , or break down and sell for spare parts .
we literally have no idea what 's caused this sudden increase .
what we are seeing is particular hot-spots of rural crime one farmer told me that there was a quad bike a week going between him and his neighbours . ''

documents.title: watch : monday 's full weather forecast
text: here 's how the day 's looking across the west midlands and you can keep yourself up-to-date at any time with the bbc weather website .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to herefordshire and worcestershire live on monday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .
